p: Piles are a common chronic painful anal disease, and a clinical trial (n = 22) used a formulation containing H. pubescens bark (25 mg/capsule) along with six other plants [ 155]. All patients completed their entire study period of four weeks, and 20 out of 22 patients showed a status of wellbeing ( P-0.01). Later, another group [ 156] also performed a clinical trial for piles, and observed that powder has significant role in stopping the bleeding in the disease Shonitarsha (bleeding piles).
